thread.section_title: Manchester United must beat AC Milan and Juventus to Nelson Semedo – Metro
thread.title: Manchester United must beat AC Milan and Juventus to Nelson Semedo
thread.title_full: Manchester United must beat AC Milan and Juventus to Nelson Semedo

author: Coral Barry
title: Manchester United must beat AC Milan and Juventus to Nelson Semedo
text:
Nelson Semedo is wanted by several clubs (Picture: Getty) Juventus and AC Milan have entered the race to sign Benfica star Nelson Semedo, according to reports in Portugal.
David Luiz provides major update on three-month knee injury Semedo has been heavily linked with a transfer to Manchester United as well as switches to Barcelona, Bayern Munich and Inter Milan.
Benfica rate their right-back at around £35 million with the Portuguese grabbing ten assists from defence this season.
Semedo is coveted by Jose Mourinho with United currently making due with either Antonio Valencia or centre-backs on the right side of defence.
Manchester United fixtures West Brom (H) – Sat 1 Apr
Everton (H) – Tue 4 Apr
Sunderland (A) – Sun 9 Apr
Anderlecht (A) – Thu 13 Apr
Chelsea (H) – Sun 16 Apr
Anderlecht (H) – Thu 20 Apr
Burnley (A) – Sun 23 Apr
Man City (A) – Thu 27 April
Swansea (A) – Sun 30 April
Semedo has been setting up his team-mates left and right this season (Picture: Getty) Reports have already claimed that United have agreed a fee for Semedo ahead of a summer move, but that transfer could now be in jeopardy.
The 23-year-old has seen his stock rise and rise this season as Semedo has put in several eye-catching displays in the Champions League.
Semedo is under contract until 2021 and Benfica currently sit top of Primeira Liga, albeit just a point ahead of Porto.
Antonio Valencia is playing at right-back despite being a natural winger (Picture: Getty) More: Football Kylian Mbappe responds to Man Utd and Arsenal transfer links 
Thibaut Courtois admits this Chelsea star constantly cons the officials 
Jamie Redknapp names the TWO teams who will miss out on the top four 
Benfica have always been willing sellers for the right price, but United will have to fend off some serious competition from clubs not afraid to spend big on top targets, according to OJogo.
Italian duo Juventus and AC Milan are on the hunt for defensive reinforcements with the Serie A champions looking for more competition for Dani Alves.
Milan have been well off the pace this season with the former giants of Italian football sitting in seventh, a full 20 points behind leaders Juventus.
MORE: Too soon for Marco Verratti to return to Italy or make Premier League switch, says agent
